revised_title: Invention and Properties of Non-Spherical Grinding Optics and Burning-Glasses
tldr: Francis Smethwick, a fellow of the Royal Society, invented a new method of grinding non-spherical optical lenses. He demonstrated the effectiveness of these lenses in telescopes and reading glasses, which provided clearer and more accurate images. Smethwick also showcased burning-glasses that could warm objects at a distance and even ignite materials. The Royal Society encouraged him to continue refining his invention and share his techniques with others.
